Package ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy

Class Policy_en

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.AbstractWordPolicy
      • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.LocalePolicy
        • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.Policy_en
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhoneticHashProvider, WordPolicy
    public class Policy_en
extends LocalePolicy
    A WordPolicy for English locales. This policy has the following features:
    1. Possessives (words ending in "'s") are accepted without question if they start with a capital and the base word (without possessive) is in the dictionary. So, if "Harry's" is submitted and "Harry" is in the dictionary, the entire word is accepted; otherwise it is rejected.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • evaluate

        public String evaluate​(String word)
        Evaluate a word under this policy. The policy can return the original string, causing the word to be checked normally. Alternatively, it can return a different string as a proxy word to be checked instead of the original word. Finally, it can return one of the special values Evaluation.REJECT_WORD or Evaluation.ACCEPT_WORD. These cause the word to immediately be either rejected as a misspelled word or accepted as a correctly spelled word, respectively. This implementation always returns the original word. The English policy removes the "'s" suffix from the end of possible possessives. This lets the spelling checker look for the root word instead, assuming that any 's word is a noun and can therefore take a possessive. Otherwise, it returns the original word unchanged.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word - the word being checked by the caller
        Returns:
        the word to be looked up, or an Evaluation code

      • modifySuggestion

        public String modifySuggestion​(String word,
                               String suggestion)
        Allows the policy to modify a suggested replacement before it is returned to the user if it wishes. This can be used in combination with WordPolicy.evaluate(java.lang.String) to transparently modify the words that are queried and fetched from the dictionary. For example, if the policy strips off affixes in evaluate, this method could be used to add the appropriate affixes back onto suggestion words so that the affixes on the suggestions agree with those of the mismatched word. If the policy does not wish to modify the suggestion, it should return suggestion unchanged. This implementation always returns the original suggestion. The English policy adds the "'s" suffix back to suggestions if it removed them from word. Otherwise, it returns the original suggestion unchanged.
        Specified by:
        modifySuggestion in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        modifySuggestion in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word - the word for which suggestions have been requested
        suggestion - a suggested replacement for the word
        Returns:
        the original suggestion or a replacement
